const char * ivrErrorDescription (ivr_error_code error)
 

Detailed Description

Error codes and their helper functions.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ivr_error_code

An enumeration of possible error codes.

Enumerator
IVR_E_OK 

No error.

IVR_E_OUT_OF_MEM 

The system ran out of memory during an allocation.

IVR_E_TIMEOUT 

A blocking call timed out and returned.

IVR_E_HID 

An error with a USB HID device.

IVR_E_SERIAL 

An error with a Serial device.

IVR_E_OS 

An OS specific error, call GetLastError() on Windows for more details.

IVR_E_ARG_NULL 

An argument was passed in as NULL.

IVR_E_ARG_RANGE 

An argument was out of the valid range.

IVR_E_NO_DEVICE 

No device present.

IVR_E_FILE_OPEN 

Error opening a file. Typically file permissions.

IVR_E_PIPE_CREATE 

Error creating a named pipe. Call GetLastError() on Windows for more detail.

IVR_E_PIPE_INVALID_OP 

An error occured while using the named pipe. Call GetLastError() on Windows for more detail.

IVR_E_RUNTIME_FAILURE 

The runtime returned an error for the command called.

Function Documentation

const char* ivrErrorDescription ( ivr_error_code  error)

Converts an error code to a string with a brief description of the error.

Useful for printing error messages out.

Parameters
[in]errorAn error code.
Returns
A string describing the error.
